column4: are there any good studio software for linux (something similar to soundforge or such programs)
have you looked at audacity?
no, but i'll check it out
this new live CD is based on ubuntu: http://distrowatch.com/table.php?distribution=demudi
ah, nice
I hope you don't let packages get removed when dependencies aren't met if you update that frequently.
perhaps run it in the background
well, yes. but that doesn't really matter, it will keep running even if you close the terminal
hehe
heh
do you have any tricks or tips for polypaudio?
no, not yet.  I'm looking at it now.  Obviously, polypaudio is not the drop-in replacement it's claimed to be!
well maybe it needs some days before totally integrated with ubuntu
perhaps
i'll check
yes, seems to be some problems loading modules and so on...
yeah
hope they'll fix it soon. don't think regular users want to edit tons of conf. files to make the sound work properly
and i'm a regular user :)
yeah, I couldn't even get it working by editing my configuration files.
no, not so far.
semms like people haven't noticed yet. only 35 ppl have read my post on the Hoary forum
it'll probably take a little time
what are you trying to run in wine?
nothing right now, but I've had huge amounts of trouble and instability trying to get dc++ to run
did you try wine and winetools .deb from winehq.com ?
yes and no. I added the wine repo to get the latest, but winetools i've never even heard of
winetools is setup to allow you to install DC++, whatever that is.
winetools is awesome.
a dc client. but now a port of it is in progress
dc?
direct connect
what is it used for?  Here's the url: http://www.winehq.com/site/download-deb
here's winetools (available in .deb from winehq.com repos): http://www.von-thadden.de/Joachim/WineTools/
I'll check it out
cool.
I tried to point it out, and got my hand slapped
we had best be patient.
ok...i'll go without soundserver for a while then
you decided not to drop back to esound?
because of the freeze?
something like that. i mean, hoary will not be a good release without a somewhat working soundserver
what I don't get is how an untested sound server that isn't working made it into Hoary after the feature freeze of Feb. 7th
well, you got a point there. but since hoary still is under development I guess one can't cry out too loud about it...
I agree, but it's odd
yepp
do you have any tips for buying a cheap soundcard with hardware mixing?
no, I've been using a laptop exclusively for 3 years now.  Sorry.
ok. think i'll try to get one, so I can turn off my built in ac97
good luck
you're getting the same thing, correct?
buddy, where are you?
last time i checked there were some polypaudio modules not loading and so on and forth
so, you no longer have the same messages in /var/log/messages?
i'll check, hold on
lots of "protocol-esound.c: read() failed: EOF "
have you got polypaudio to work properly now?
sure do
you?
no :/ what did you do (you can tell me in a query if you wish)
try this:  http://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-users/2005-February/022862.html
ok, will do
hey
hello
how are you?
well, i'm fine but the "winter vomit desease" is spreading at work...eeek...
hey there
what's new?
well, not much. still fighting with polypaudio...
me too...I'm not even bothering with it for now.
no, feels like it's not worth the effort. thin i'll buy a cheap sound card capable of hardware mixing instead
I'm building a mythtv box this week.
mythtv box?
PVR
ah, so you'll have a standalone tuner box?
yes.  It should be fun
mhm
is your polypaudio behaving now without the #define MAX_CONNECTIONS 10
did you see the update to polypaudio?
yes...but I still have the same problems I think...
oh...it's working for me.
it probably is my nforce2 onboard sound card
possbile.  I actually have no errors in /var/log/messages now.
what's up?
I use one for NAT:ing purposes
only two MAC addresses allowed / student apartment here
cool, I do mac filtering with my wireless AP/router
and a mountpoint ;)
is that bug fixed yet?
it appears to be, yes.
ah, lookie...the recent documents is cleared
so, are you running breezy yet? I find it really hard to resist the part of my linux brain that want's to upgrade, but I guess i'll only find myself in a hell of breakage if i do :)
no, I'm not, actually.  I'm likely going to setup a breezy chroot on an hoary installation.
you've seen the topic?
of course
Nermal: I just want to make sure I won't upgrade :P
